item.title: Um some help!
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

ok, first and last time

runescape uses an archived jar client on their website which allows you to play runescape. we download this client un archive it and can now view its BIN (class) files, however these files are Obfuscated meaning we need an De-Obfuscator so we can view the code.
jagex uses ZKM to obfuscate its file names so we shall first put the files through the ZKM Stripper.
now that we have the Un-Obfuscated Class names, we still have the BIN Files and not the SRC (java) files.
so somepeople (Saev) made some BCEL Transformers so the BIN files are put through that creating SRC Files, however some of the code is uncompileable meaning we need to use a Decompiler to get the last bits of UnCompileable Code, we use a Decompiler called JODE as it is free and powerful.

we can now use the SRC Files to edit the client and do what we want with it. however about every week jagex updates the client meaning we have to do the process again, most of the methods and variable names change so you have to recreate the edit you did on the client before.

i hope that clears it up

Read full topic
